item.title: Shutdown/Restart Windows Without Long API Calls
item.author: Jamin Wong A-13-3a, Aman Puri editorial@devx.com
item.description: This tip tells you how you can shutdown or restart Windows with one line of code, avoiding those long API calls.

item.title: How to Determine the Item Selected from a Property Grid Drop-down List
item.author: Vladimir Shaposhnik set37@go.com
item.description: In Visual Studio, when you select an item on a form you're building, the Property Grid appears and lets you set various properties (e.g. background color, width, height, text color, etc.) from a two-column table. This tip shows how to know which item a user selects from the drop-down list.

item.title: Favor the Function Object to the Function Pointer in STL Algorithms
item.author: Saurabh Ramya saurabhramya@yahoo.com
item.description: Many of the STL algorithms have two versions, with one version taking one less parameter than what the second version takes. Learn the difference between the function pointer and the function object and why one is more effective than the other.

item.title: A Better Way to Validate a Node Checkbox in a Treeview
item.author: Eric van emrvblokland@planet.nl
item.description: This tip provides a workaround for validating a noce checkbox in a treeview.

item.title: Persist Java Objects in a File and Retrieve Them Later
item.author: Amit Tuli amittuli@yahoo.com
item.description: This tip explains how to persist a Java object in a file which can be retrieved back later.

item.title: Registering ActiveX Files
item.author: Ita Taka takaita@gmail.com
item.description: Find out an easy way to register ActiveX files.

item.title: Generate HTML Reports from Scheduled SQL Server Maintenance Activities
item.author: Parthasarathy Mandayam mcp111@hotmail.com
item.description: Learn how to use the SQLMAINT application to automatically generate a user-friendly, Web-based report of uitlity activities.

item.title: Set Two Items of a Property Grid from the Drop-down List
item.author: Vladimir Shaposhnik set37@go.com
item.description: The example in this tip demonstrates the technique for setting two items of a property grid from the drop-down list

item.title: Read Time Zone Names Stored in the Registry
item.author: Dinesh Asanka dineshasanka@yahoo.com
item.description: The following code reads the time zone names stored in the registry and places those names in a combobox.

item.title: Create a Taxonomy in UDDI Using UDDI4J
item.author: Sujata De sujata.de@hp.com
item.description: Learn how to create a tModel taxonomy in UDDI for WSDL specifications using UDDI4J.

item.title: Find the nth Maximum and Minimum Values in a Given Column
item.author: Sridhar MS editorial@devx.com
item.description: This SQL code retrieves the nth Maximum and nth Minimum values in the column specified in <COLUMNNAME> from the table <TABLENAME>.

item.title: Partially Optional Function Parameters in VBScript 5.0+
item.author: Parthasarathy Mandayam mcp111@hotmail.com
item.description: Did you know that VBScript doesn't require you to provide all of a function's parameters when you call it? Learn how to use this feature with this tip.

item.title: Use the "Service Locator" Design Pattern with the J2EE Architechture
item.author: Mouli Chandra write2mouli@yahoo.com

item.title: Using STL Binders
item.author: Saurabh Ramya saurabhramya@yahoo.com
item.description: Learn how to use STL binders to use binary function objects as unary function objects in many STL algorithms which need them.

item.title: Use java.util.Observable to Monitor Object State changes
item.author: Amit Tuli amittuli@yahoo.com
item.description: Use the class java.util.Observable to monitor Java objects for any change in their states.
